Node
It works similarly to the popular asthma medication theophylline, which opens up the airways.Drink hot tea/coffee to breathe better.
Garlic is suitable in the early stages of asthma as it can quickly clear congestion in the lungs.Put garlic in your food.
Recent studies encourage the use of ginger for asthma sufferers as it has shown to improve symptoms.
Omega-3 acid is naturally found in oily fish and helps to reduce airway inflammation and also helps to enhance lung function.
Drinking lemon juice reduces the symptoms associated with asthma, as lemons are rich in Vitamin C.
Asthma sufferers should be careful about avoiding foods they’re sensitive to.Some of the foods that may cause an allergic reaction are eggs,peanuts,tree nuts,shellfish,wheat etc
Sulfites can possibly trigger asthma symptoms.They are often used to preserve food and can be found in:Red Wine/Beer,Pickled Foods,Dried Fruits,Bottled Lemon/Lime Juice,Maraschino Cherries.
Eating large meals or foods that cause gas will put pressure on your diaphragm and may cause chest tightness and trigger asthma flares.These foods include:fried foods,carbonated drinks,onions etc.

1) Bronchodilators tablets
2) Steroid tablets
3) Anti-inflammatory
4) Quick-relief inhalers containing albuterol.
5)Oral corticosteroids
Ginger’s potent anti-inflammtory properties were key in the root’s powers to combat a cold or flu.It boost your immunity.
Water can be one of the most helpful drinks to sip. Staying hydrated can help loosen trapped mucus.Drinking at least eight glasses of water a day.
Broccoli help boost immunity.It combat free radicals in your body and prevent you from getting sick.
Spinach is a major superfood that is great for your overall health.It contains vitamin C that help reduce symptoms of sickness.
"An apple a day keeps the doctor away". These antioxidants help boost immunity and reduce the risk of chronic diseases.
Caffeinated drinks should be avoided as they are dehydrating. They include coffee, cola drinks, energy drinks and tea.
Alcohol is also dehydrating and should be avoided.It affects the functioning of the immune system and makes you more likely to get an infection.
Hard or jagged foods like crunchy crackers, chips, and foods with similar textures can aggravate a cough and sore throat.
Greasy foods tend to make you feel worse, as it can increase inflammation
Sour, pickled, or brined foods contain vinegar and or salt, so they can increase inflammation in a sore throat.

1)COLDARIN ALL IN 1®(containing Paracetamol, Diphenhydramine, Phenylephrine)
2)Cetirizine
3)Oseltamivir (Tamiflu®)
Foods like turkey, tuna, and chicken have an amino acid called tryptophan, which may help you make serotonin.Which need to clear your mind and boost your energy.
Depression is higher in people with low levels of vitamin D.People with seasonal affective disorder,tended to get better when the amount of vitamin D in their bodies went up.
Studies have reported a link between lowNuts selenium and poor moods.It is probably best to focus on foods:Beans and legumes,whole grains,nuts/seeds.
People that do not eat enough omega-3s may have higher rates of major depressive disorder.
Alcohol even a little can mess up your sleep. Not enough rest can raise anxiety and cause depression.
This one is only for people who are sensitive to gluten.It can cause anxiety/depression and make you feel sluggish and not at your best.
If you eat lots of processed meat,fried food,refined cereals,candy,and high-fat dairy products, you’re more likely to be anxious and depressed.
White bread is highly processed white flour that can quickly turns to blood sugar after you eat it and can cause energy spikes and crashes that can be bad for anxiety and depression.
It has all of the blood-spiking sugar that have a direct link to depression.Too much of the caffeine that many sodas have can be bad for anxiety, too.

Antidepressant:-
1)Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors(SSRIs)
2)Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors(SNRIs)
3)Tricyclic antidepressants(TCAs)
4)Monoamine oxidase inhibitors(MAOIs)
Leafy green vegetables are extremely nutritious and low in calories.They’re also very low in digestible carbs,so they won’t significantly affect blood sugar levels.
Avocados have less than 1 gram of sugar, few carbohydrates, a high fiber content, and healthy fats,so you don’t have to worry about them raising your blood sugar levels.
Chia seeds are a wonderful food for people with diabetes.Chia seeds may also help maintain glycemic management in individuals with diabetes.
Greek Yogurt is a great dairy choice for people with diabetes.Yogurt consumption may be associated with lower levels of blood glucose and insulin resistance.
All types of nuts contain fiber and are low in net carbs.Regular consumption may reduce inflammation and lower blood sugar,cholesterol levels.
Broccoli may also help manage your blood sugar levels.Consuming broccoli sprouts led to a 10% reduction in blood glucose in people with diabetes.
Sugary beverages are the worst drink choice for someone with diabetes.It may increase the risk of diabetes-related conditions like fatty liver disease.
Eating bread, bagels, and other refined-flour foods has been shown to significantly increase blood sugar levels in people.
Flavored yogurts are typically made from nonfat or low fat milk and loaded with carbs and may contain almost 31 grams of sugar.
Rice contains gluten which raise blood sugar.High carb foods not only raised blood sugar but also decreased brain function.

Type 1 diabetes medication:
1)Insulin
2)Amylinomimetic drug

Type 2 diabetes medication:
1)Alpha-glucosidase inhibitors
2)Biguanides
3)DPP-4 inhibitors
4)Thiazolidinediones.
Citrus fruits, including grapefruit, oranges, and lemons, may have powerful blood-pressure-lowering effects.It may help keep your heart healthy by reducing heart disease risk factors.
Fatty fish are an excellent source of omega-3 fats, which have significant heart health benefits.It may help reduce blood pressure levels by reducing inflammation.
Swiss chard is a leafy green that’s packed with blood-pressure-regulating nutrients, including potassium and magnesium.
Pumpkin seeds are concentrated source of nutrients important for blood pressure control.It essential for blood vessel relaxation and blood pressure reduction.
Broccoli may help lower blood pressure by enhancing blood vessel function and increasing nitric oxide levels in your body.
Greek yogurt is a nutrient-dense dairy product that’s packed with minerals that help regulate blood pressure.
Frozen pizza are high in sugar, saturated fat, and sodium.Frozen pizza can have especially high levels of sodium.
The longer vegetables sit in canning and preserving liquids, the more sodium they pick up.
Sugar can increase your blood pressure in several ways.Sugar-sweetened drinks contributes to weight gain in adults and children.
Drinking too much alcohol can increaseTrusted Source your blood pressure.In addition,many alcoholic drinks are high in sugar and calories.
Most canned tomato sauces, pasta sauces, and tomato juices are high in sodium and they can cause raise your blood pressure.

High blood pressure drugs
1)Diuretics(water pills)
2)Beta-blockers
3)Alpha-beta-blockers
4)Calcium channel blockers
5)Alpha-1 blockers
6)Alpha-2 receptor agonists
7)Vasodilators
Eating inflammation-fighting foods may help reduce migraines.Omega-3 fatty acids can help decrease inflammation.Foods include:salmon, flaxseed, olive oil, and walnuts.
Staying hydrated is key when it comes to migraine management because dehydration is a common migraine trigger.In fact, mild to moderate headaches can be a sign of dehydration
Caffeine, which is found in tea, coffee, and soda, has a delicate relationship with migraines.Caffeine can actually help people who are in the midst of a migraine attack.
Dark chocolate contains large amounts of magnesium, the relaxation mineral,which the most commonly used minerals for Migraine management.It is vital for relaxation and proper sleep.
Carrots are high in beta-carotene and other nutrients with anti-inflammatory properties
Collard greens including cabbage and broccoli are a “neutral” food they pose no known risk of triggering a Migraine attack.It is extremely high in magnesium.
Nuts like almonds, peanuts, and many other nuts and seeds contain tyramine.But not all migraine sufferers are sensitive to nuts.
Red wine is the most commonly-reported trigger as it contains a lot of histamine.
Aged Cheeses like blue cheese, brie, cheddar, swiss, feta, mozzarella, and most common migraine trigger as it contains tyramine.

Excessive caffeine consumption can trigger migraines.People who consume too much caffeine can increases their risk of experiencing caffeine withdrawal symptoms when they stop consuming it, including anxiety and headache.

Drugs That Stop Migraine Headaches(Abortive drugs)
1)ibuprofen
2)aspirin
3)acetaminophen
4)naproxen

Nausea Drugs for Migraines
1)chlorpromazine
2)prochlorperazine
3)metoclopramide hydrochloride
Iodine is an essential mineral that’s needed to make thyroid hormones and its deficiency might cause hypothyroidism.Iodine-rich foods includes seaweed,fish,dairy,eggs.
Selenium helps “activate” thyroid hormones.Selenium-rich foods includes Brazil nuts, tuna, sardines, eggs, and legumes.
Zinc helps the body “activate” thyroid hormones.Zinc-rich foods includes oysters and other shellfish, beef, and chicken.
Soy also called isoflavones increase a person risk for hypothyroidism.Foods With Soy,includes Edamame, Tofu, and Miso
Cruciferous vegetables, such as broccoli and cabbage may interfere with the production of thyroid hormone if you have an iodine deficiency.
Gluten a protein found in foods processed from wheat, barley, rye, and other grains may hamper absorption of thyroid hormone replacement medication.
Fatty Foods such as Butter,Meat and fried absorb thyroid hormone replacement medicines and may also interfere with the thyroids ability to produce hormone.
Alcohol consumption can wreak havoc on both thyroid hormone levels in the body and the ability of the thyroid to produce hormone.

Hypothyroidism medications:

1)levothyroxine (Levoxyl, Synthroid)
2)T4 and triiodothyronine (T3)
3)Tapazole (methimazole)
4)Propylthiouracil (PTU)
Legumes that includes beans, peas and lentils contain a lot of fiber, minerals and protein that can lower your risk of heart disease.
Avocados is a nutrient-dense fruit which is a rich source of monounsaturated fats and fiber that lowers cholesterol.
Nuts especially Almonds and Walnuts are very high in monounsaturated fats.Walnut is also rich in omega-3,associated with heart health.
Whole Grains especially Oats and Barley lower heart disease risk by 20% and promote heart health.
Dark Chocolate and Cocoa protect the “bad” LDL cholesterol in your blood from oxidation, which is a key cause of heart disease.
Soy foods like Soybeans are a type of legume that may be beneficial for heart health.It reduces “bad” LDL and increases “good” HDL cholesterol.
Cheese provides 27 mg of cholesterol and must be avoided.
Fried Foods have high-cholesterol and should be avoided whenever possible.It can contain trans fats, which increase heart disease risk.
Cookies,cakes,ice cream,and other sweets are unhealthy foods that tend to be high in cholesterol, as well as added sugars, unhealthy fats and calories.
Shellfish including clams, crab and shrimp are high in cholesterol and must be avoided.

Cholesterol medications/drugs:

1)Atorvastatin (Lipitor)
2)Lovastatin (Altoprev)
3)Ezetimibe (Zetia)
4)Alirocumab (Praluent)
5)Bempedoic acid (Nexletol)
6)Colestipol (Colestid)
6)Ezetimibe-simvastatin (Vytorin)
7)Amlodipine-atorvastatin (Caduet)
Raw juices of certain vegetables, especially carrots and spinach, have been found valuable in the treatment of conjunctivitis.
Vitamin A like milk, curds, butter, carrots, pumpkins, green leafy vegetables, tomatoes, mangoes and papayas have been found valuable in the treatment of conjunctivitis.
Foods rich in vitamin B2 are green leafy vegetables, milk, almonds, citrus fruits, bananas and tomatoes are valuable in the treatment of conjunctivitis.
Fresh fruit diet consisting of apples, oranges, pears, grapes, pineapples and grapefruits should be taken.
Bananas should not be taken in fruit diet in conjunctivitis.
Excessive intake of starchy and sugary foods in the form of white bread,refined cereals,potatoes,puddings,pastry,sugar and jams,which cause the general catarrhal condition as well as conjunctivitis.
Excessive salt intake should be avoided in conjunctivitis.
Fatty foods such as Butter,Meat and fried should be avoided.

Pharmacies to treat bacterial conjunctivitis:

->Chloramphenicol eye drop.

Allergic conjunctivitis:

->antihistamines(anti-allergy).
Bananas are bland and easily digested, making them a good choice for settling an upset digestive system.It is excellent source of potassium, an important electrolyte.
Oats are another source of soluble fiber. As a bulking agent for stool, it can help reduce diarrhea.Plain white rice is easily digested,which means it helps firm up loose stools.
Protein like steamed white meat chicken is one of the most easily digested.Lean cuts of turkey, beef, pork, and fish are also acceptable.
Water and Coconut water is another hydrating choice.
Addition of zinc or zinc supplements also help in reducing the severity and duration of diarrhoea episode. Some good food sources of zinc are curd, rice, rajmah, spinach, garlic and fruits.
Sabudana is also a great source of starch.It is a good semi-liquid food option helping bind the water in the intestine and controlling the frequency of diarrhoea.
Boiling and immediate cooling of potato helps develop resistant starch, which improves water and electrolyte absorption helping to control the diarrhoea.

Avoid milk,paneer and sweetened milk products like kheer,sweets made from milk.They are concentrated sources of energy which may be difficult for the intestine to digest and absorb, creating a new condition like osmotic diarrhoea.
Avoid spicy food as they irritate the small intestine.Instead curd rice, khichdi, kadhi-rice etc. are some good options.
Avoid tea/coffee/sweetened beverages such as colas, aerated beverages etc. They may further aggravate dehydration (water loss).
Avoid broccoli, cauliflower, peppers, peas, green leafy vegetables, and corn, as they tend to cause gas.

Medicines to relieve diarrhea:

1)Oral rehydration solution (ORS)
2)Loperamide (Imodium)
3)Bismuth subsalicylate (Kaopectate, Pepto-Bismol)
Kiwifruit possess numerous vitamins and minerals and can improve sleep.People who ate two kiwis one hour before bedtime found that they fell asleep faster.
Malted milk before bed reduced sleep interruptions.Milk are melatonin -enriched.Taking Nighttime milk may be useful in providing a natural source of the sleep-producing hormone.
Fatty fish may be a good food for better sleep.People who ate salmon three times per week had better overall sleep as well as improved daytime functioning.
Nuts like almonds, walnuts9, pistachios, and cashews are good food for sleep.Nuts contain melatonin,that helped older adults with insomnia get better sleep.
Rice consumption with improved sleep.High glycemic index around four hours before bedtime helped with falling asleep.
Even if it might make you drowsy, it affects the quality of your sleep and you will end up waking up more often and not sleeping deeply.
Sugary beverages increase your energy level making it more difficult for you to fall asleep.
People who often eat high-fat foods gain weight and their sleep cycles tend to get disrupted as it activates digestion, which can lead to nighttime trips to the bathroom.
Beware of Hidden Caffeine like coffee,chocolate,cola, and tea as it might disrupt your sleep.

Medications to treat insomnia:

1)Antidepressants such as trazodone (Desyrel)
2)Benzodiazepines
3)Doxepine (Silenor)
4)Eszopiclone (Lunesta)
5)Lemborexant (Dayvigo)

string-array.name: diabetes_symptoms
string-array.item: Urinate (pee) a lot, often at night
Gets hungry after small intervals of food intake
Have numb or tingling hands or feet

string-array.name: migrane_symptoms
string-array.item: Mood changes, from depression to euphoria(Getting Sudden Excited)
Much Food cravings when mind is not stable
Increased thirst and urination during severe headache
Frequent yawning while not able to sleep during headache

string-array.name: hyperthyroid_symptoms
string-array.item: Having an enlarged thyroid gland or a goiter
Experiencing irregular menstrual periods or having your menstrual cycle stop
Having vision problems or eye irritation

string-array.name: hypothyroid_symptoms
string-array.item: Feeling tired (fatigue) with doing a little work
Having frequent and heavy menstrual periods
Experiencing an intolerance to cold temperatures

string-array.name: congenital_heart_disease_symptoms
string-array.item: Abnormal heart rhythms (arrhythmias) either too fast or too slow
A bluish tint to the skin, lips, and fingernails
Swelling of body tissue or organs (edema)

string-array.name: thalassemia_symptoms
string-array.item: Feeling Regular Weakness on daily basics

string-array.name: rheumatoid_arthritis_symptoms
string-array.item: Joint stiffness is usually worse in the mornings and after inactivity
Fatigue, fever, and loss of appetite
Black/ Red spots on the body without any skincare

resources.string-array:
Are very thirsty
Lose weight without trying
Gets hungry after small intervals of food intake
Have blurry vision
Feel very tired
Have very dry skin
Have sores that heal slowly
Have more infections than usual//8
//Migrane
Constipation
Much Food cravings when mind is not stable
Increased thirst and urination during severe headache
Frequent yawning while not able to sleep during headache//12
//Hyper thyroid Symptoms…
Experiencing anxiety, irritability, and nervousness
Having trouble sleeping
Having an enlarged thyroid gland or a goiter
Experiencing irregular menstrual periods or having your menstrual cycle stop
Feeling sensitive to heat
Having vision problems or eye irritation//18
//Hypo thyroid Symptoms…
Feeling tired (fatigue) with doing a little work
Having frequent and heavy menstrual periods
Having dry and coarse hair
Having a hoarse voice
Experiencing an intolerance to cold temperatures//23
//Congenital heart disease…
Shortness of breath
Tiring quickly upon exertion
Swelling of body tissue or organs (edema)//26
//Thalesemia disease…
Fatigue after doing work
Feeling Regular Weakness on daily basics
Pale or yellowish skin
Facial bone deformities
Slow growth
Abdominal swelling
Dark urine(Normally)//33
//rheumatoid_arthritis…
Tender, warm, swollen joints
Joint stiffness is usually worse in the mornings and after inactivity
Fatigue, fever, and loss of appetite
Eyes redness//37
resources.string: Genetic disease are something which are caused by the occurrence of mutations in the genetic material of the individual. An Android App that reads the sequenced DNA of all biological species and detects the imprints of the the nucleotides present in it i.e…detecting the genetic mutational change from of a sequenced DNA. It acts as a mini feasible tool for the genetic researchers and for the bio-tech field. It also helps to analyze the probability of disease in the next generation based on the concept of pedigree analysis which even a person from non- bio background can even understand. This gives the detailed information even in the bar graph to check and compare quantity of the proteins present in ones DNA Also with this it will be more helpful for the people to understand the implications and probability of the diseases specially in the embryonic condition through which technologies like GENE THERAPY could be implemented at the right time. Even after the birth the Implications of the Disease could be minimized having known the prior probability.
